name: Path T Mycosis Fungoides
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:** For skin, patch indicates any size skin lesion without significant elevation or induration.

**Note 2:** For skin, plaque indicates any size skin lesion that is elevated or indurated.

**Note 3:** For skin, tumor indicates at least one 1 centimeter (cm) diameter solid or nodular lesion with evidence of depth and/or vertical growth. If a physician describes a skin lesion of less than 1 cm as a tumor, code T2.

**Note 4:** Use code T1 when skin involvement is present but only a general location/site is mentioned (i.e., face, torso, arms, legs). 

**Note 5:** Ignore erythroderma if stated to involve less than 50% of the skin. Erythrodema greater than 50% is coded as a T3.

**Note 6:** Physicians use more than one method to estimate percentage of skin involvement by mycosis fungoides (MF).  Code percent of skin involvement as stated by the physician.  If no percentage is stated and no word such as localized or generalized is used and no stage is given, code as percent not stated.

**Note 7:**  Assign T0 ONLY when there is no evidence of any type of skin involvement, including plaques, papules, patches, or tumors.  Note, tumor size is coded as 000 in Tumor Size only if there is no evidence of any tumor(s).
rows:
Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed
Not documented in patient record
Limited patches, papules, and/or plaques covering <10% of skin surface

Note: T1 has subcategories of T1a and T1b. Assign T1 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Skin involvement less than 10%, not stated whether plaques, papules or patches, no tumors 
    Limited plaques/patches
Plaques, papules, or erythematous patches: % body surface not stated, no tumors

Skin involvement, NOS:
    Extent not stated, no tumors
    Localized, NOS

Stated as T1 [NOS]

Patches only with less than 10% of skin surface  involved

Stated as T1a

Plaques or papules, with or without patches, with less than 10% of skin surface involved, no tumors

Stated as T1b
Patches, papules or plaques covering >= 10% of the skin surface

Note: T2 has subcategories of T2a and T2b. Assign T2 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Skin involvement 10% or more, not stated whether plaques, papules or patches, no tumors
Skin lesion described as tumor less than 1 cm
Generalized plaques/patches

Stated as T2 [NOS]

Patches only with  10% or more of skin surface  involved

Stated as T2a

Plaques or papules, with or without patches, with 10% or more of skin surface involved, no tumors

Stated as T2b
One or more tumors (>= 1 cm diameter)

Cutaneous tumor, size not stated
Generalized erythroderma 
(Greater than 50% less than 80% body surface involved with diffuse redness)

Stated as T3
Confluence of erythema covering >=80% body surface area

Generalized erythroderma
Equal to or greater than or equal to 80%  body surface involved with diffuse redness

Stated as T4
